newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold trade lively on pre-holiday demand.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold trade lively on pre-holiday demand.

text.p: The Istanbul gold exchange saw lively trading on Wednesday on physical demand boosted by lower prices ahead of religious holidays, dealers said.

Traded volume on the exchange jumped to 1,751 kilos from 738 kilos on Tuesday with demand coming from traders and jewellers in Istanbul's grand bazaar, the centre of Turkey's unregulated gold trade, the dealers said.
Gold closed easier at $340.50 an ounce and 1,457,200 lira per gram, down sharply from $345 and 1,466,000 lira at Wednesday's close, following lower levels in European markets.

"There was quite a lot of demand coming from the bazaar today with traders there expecting consumer sales during the holiday and wishing to increase their stocks before the exchange closes," one dealer said.
The exchange will close for the religious holiday at midday on Thursday and will reopen on April 22, but will again be closed for a national holiday on April 23.
Most of the day's trade -- 1,376 kilos -- was in the morning session with 67.2 percent of total trade conducted in lira terms.
